<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 2"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Horizon Walker Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=1987) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 177 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Horizon Walker](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=63)

**Prerequisites**
Trained in [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16)

</column>

---

You've mastered travel within a specific type of terrain. You gain the [Favored Terrain](/Feats.aspx?ID=495) feat. When in your favored terrain, you gain a +10-foot circumstance bonus to your travel Speed. When other creatures [Follow the Expert](/Actions.aspx?ID=514) with you as a guide in your favored terrain, they gain both the ability to ignore non-magical difficult terrain for the purpose of their travel Speed and the bonus to travel Speed.

**Special** You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the horizon walker archetype.

<title level="2">Horizon Walker Dedication leads to...</title>
[Acclimatization](/Feats.aspx?ID=1988), [Magical Adaptation](/Feats.aspx?ID=1991), [Perpetual Scout](/Feats.aspx?ID=1990), [Rebel's Map](/Feats.aspx?ID=4135), [Sure Foot](/Feats.aspx?ID=1989), [Wild Strider](/Feats.aspx?ID=1992)
